sentences: John Fereday Preston Waterhouse (28 October 1877 - 22 May 1970) was a Canadian violinist, conductor, and music educator.
Born in Bilston, West Midlands, he was educated at the Royal Academy of Music (RAM) where he was a pupil of Ã‰mile Sauret (violin), Ebenezer Prout (counterpoint), and Stewart Macpherson (harmony).
Sometime around the year 1910, Waterhouse left England for the United States to join the Minneapolis Symphony Orchestra.
